channel.title: Giving your char a red glow
channel.description:
Using Testscape
I was wondering if someone had a code to give your person a red glow like the portals in castle wars but it followed you and such
Also i could not find a tutorial on this anywhere
help is appreciated :P

oops ty m8. No harm in correcting my mistakes

item.source: Giving your char a red glow

item.title: Giving your char a red glow
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

^ isn’t that red glow boolean the exact same thing I typed above with Pglow? except it’s different words…

[quote=“zyle1992, post:17, topic:62098”]ok if you want it on and off, with a command do these:

  1. with you other booleans add this:

public boolean redglow = true;

then declare this somewhere (declare=put), i can’t remember where.

if(redglow == true){ stillgfx(246, absY, absX); }

then with your other commands, add these

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“glowon”) && playerRights >=3){
redglow = true;
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“glowoff”) && playerRights >=3){
redglow = false;
}[/code]

i can’t remember the exact tutorial, that was just, off the top of my head. hope that helps.[/quote]

Just typed essentially the same thing at the beginning of the thread…

Read full topic

item.title: Giving your char a red glow
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

ok if you want it on and off, with a command do these:

  1. with you other booleans add this:

public boolean redglow = true;

then declare this somewhere (declare=put), i can’t remember where.

if(redglow == true){ stillgfx(246, absY, absX); }

then with your other commands, add these

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“glowon”) && playerRights >=3){
redglow = true;
}

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“glowoff”) && playerRights >=3){
redglow = false;
}[/code]

i can’t remember the exact tutorial, that was just, off the top of my head. hope that helps.

item.description:
@rawr_app wrote:

i compiled it and this is what i got:

client.java:10283: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable pglow
location: class client
pglow = true;
^
client.java:10287: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable pglow
location: class client
pglow = false;
^
client.java:12465: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable pglow
location: class client
if (pglow == true) {//red player Glow
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
3 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

EDIT: im using The Perfect Compiler v 1.7
EDIT:also what is -Xlint? so far i think its an option but im not sure

item.title: Giving your char a red glow
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

[quote=“sonjichan, post:4, topic:62098”]I believe anywhere under the part that says…

public boolean process() {

put this in your client.java.

if (pglow == true) {//red player Glow stillgfx(246, absY, absX); }

then add this command in with your other commands

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("playerglow") && playerRights >= 2) { pglow = true; }

and if you want an option to turn it off… this is optionall

add this under it.

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("nopglow") && playerRights >= 2) { pglow = false; } [/quote]

Also you do have to declare the boolean pglow.

Read full topic
item.source: Giving your char a red glow
